EV isolated method:
Peripheral blood samples were collected and preserved in accordance with a previously described method [11], [12]. All patients and volunteers fasted for 8 h and abandoned the first tube after early morning blood draw. Then, 10 mL of whole blood was collected using an EDTA anticoagulant tube and centrifuged at 3000 ×g for 15 min for the removal of blood cells and fragments. Plasma exosomes were extracted with exoEasy Maxi kit (QIAGEN, Germany) in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions. Finally, 200 μL of exosomes were obtained and stored separately at −80 °C. A transmission electron microscope (Hitachi, H-7650) was used in evaluating morphology at an acceleration voltage of 80 kV. 
[11] R. Lacroix, C. Judicone, M. Mooberry, M. Boucekine, N. Key, F. Dignat-George
